definition: Lin Shu (1852-1924), writer and influential translator and adaptor of vast swathes of Western literature into Classical Chinese
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)

sentences.english: At the moment of the national crisis, Lin Shu was willing to be a "crowing cock at dawn".
sentences.chinese: 在國難當頭的危機時刻，林紓甘做“叫旦之雞”。
